intro: Leptorkis revoluta, commonly known as the revolute leptorkis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and distinctive, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Native to regions of southern Africa, it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
